text: Acleris foliana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Arizona, California, Colorado, Utah and Wyoming. The wingspan is 16–18 mm. Adults have been recorded on wing from May to August.mothphotographersgroup The larvae feed on Cercocarpus betuloides, Cercocarpus ledifolius and Cercocarpus montanus.Tortricidae Food Plant Database ==References== Category:Moths described in 1879 foliana Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris foliana
